result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Todd Fuller

defendant.name: Fuller, Michael Todd
defendant.address: 111 North Jefferson Street, Green Bay, WI 54301

records.addlTxt:
8:00 AM Defendant Michael Todd Fuller in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Michael Todd Fuller.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Spansail provides plea form.
DA heard on agreement.
Atty Spansail agrees.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1 as a Repeater.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 4 without the Repeater enhancer.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Non-citizen advisory.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on jury until civil rights are restored.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Elements of offense.
Court reviews prior conviction.
Deft agrees.
Atty Spansail agrees.
DA agrees.
Atty Spansail satisfied.
Factual basis.

Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to Count 1 as a Repeater and Count 4 without the Repeater enhancer.
Court dismisses the Repeater enhancer from Count 4.
Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2, 3, and 5.
Court orders presentence investigation be completed.  
Agent to provide report to court at least 2 weeks prior to sentencing. 
8:18 off record.
8:19 AM back on record.
Court schedules with parties.
Court orders deft to go to the DOC office today to schedule an appointment for the PSI.
Court orders Deft to cooperate with the PSI process.
8:21 AM
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

8:14 AM Defendant Michael Todd Fuller appeared by ZOOM, in custody in Brown County Jail.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Michael Todd Fuller.  Attorney Kathryn Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Spansail heard - has discussed the newest offer with Deft.
Deft would like to accept the offer.
Deft heard - would like to be present in person for a plea hearing.
Deft heard on time remaining in custody at Brown County.
Court schedules with parties.
8:20 AM
Plea hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:00 am.

3:26 PM Defendant Michael Todd Fuller not in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Michael Todd Fuller.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
DA heard - Deft is in Brown County but ZOOM request was not put in place for today's hearing.
Atty Spansail heard - has not spoken to the Deft about the most recent offer.
Court schedules with parties.
If just a status, Deft may appear by ZOOM from Brown County.
3:28 PM
Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.

3:13 PM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Todd Fuller in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Michael Todd Fuller. 
Atty Spansail - waiver today, provides form.
Atty Spansail - reviewed w/client and satisfied.
Court reviews form w/Deft.
Deft waives prelim.
Court finds Deft freely waives prelim and binds over for trial.
Court moves to arraignment.
DA indicates information will track comp.
Atty Spansail - waives reading, enters n/g pleas.
Court schedules STC w/parties.
3:18 pm
Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 02:50 pm.

9:24 AM Defendant Michael Todd Fuller in court.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Spansail appears in court with the deft.
Court calls case.
Court inquires on atty.
Deft heard - qualifies for PD representation.
9:25 Atty Spansail enters.
Copy of complaint.
Atty Spansail heard - has not reviewed with deft, but deft understands charges and penalties.
Waives formal readings.
Requests prelim and waives time limits.
Court schedules.
9:26 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

1:50 PM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Todd Fuller appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brad Hansen appeared by video.
Copy of amended comp.
Atty Hansen - received/reviewed.
DA heard on bail and priors.
Atty Hansen heard on bail.
Court sets $1,000 cash w/conditions: sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid RX, no operating a motor vehicle w/o valid DL. 
Court schedules w/parties.
1:56 pm
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
